description: Centered hexamorphic numbers: suppose k-th centered hexagonal number H_c(k) (A003215) ends in k; sequence gives value of H_c(k).
comments: Note that all centered hexamorphic numbers end in the digits 1 and 7.
references: C. Pickover, Wonders of Numbers, Oxford University Press, NY, 2001, p. 152-155.
links: C. A. Pickover, "Wonders of Numbers, Adventures in Mathematics, Mind and Meaning," Zentralblatt review
example: 127 is centered hexamorphic because it is the 7th centered hexagonal number and ends in 7. 817 is the 17th centered hexagonal and ends in 17.
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Mar 18 2001
